channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024080505
item.description:
Report E-2024080505

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: WATERFORD TOWNSHIP
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift accident puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized the recovered material and the damaged pail into one (1) 15-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080525
item.description:
Report E-2024080525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/25/24 at approximately 1000et the container was noticed that approximately a cup of material was released. They then put down some absorbent to address the material and then called for a team to come and do the clean-up. The team showed up at approximately 1300et. The downed the proper PPE and began the clean up. They collected the material and added it to the container. They also found that the seal non the container was damaged and replaced it to address the issue. The clean-up was complete by 1700.

item.title: Report E-2024080447
item.description:
Report E-2024080447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: WHITMORE LAKE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19 , 2024, at 1655 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Whitmore Lake, Michigan regarding the release of GARDACID P 4354 (UN3264, Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Inorganic, n.o.s, 8, II). Environmental Restoration contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all clean up activities. Upon the arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 cup of material impacting a 1ft x 1ft area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Contractors cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE, then transferred the residual material in the damaged tote into a new IBC plastic tote. The spent absorbents and cut up damaged tote were containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF as waste and staged onsite by contractors pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080337
item.description:
Report E-2024080337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: WESTLAND
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A drum was being transferred to the dock at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Westland, MI when the drum fell off the pallet. Upon investigation, it was found that the pallet was damaged, as well as the drum's bung was not secure, so when the drum fell off, the bung released from the drum causing approximately 5-gallons of waste flammable corrosive liquid material to spill.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADED IN AN INBOUND TRAILER. HE TOLD RESPONDER ABOUT THE PACKAGE AND HE WENT INTO THE TRAILER TO REMOVE IT. PACKAGE WAS ON THE BOTTOM OF A BUILT PACKAGE WALL. RESPONDER REMOVED PACKAGE AND STARTED DMP. UNDECLARED HAZARDOUS WASTE, LIQUID, N.O.S.
